ratings.comment: Amazing professor, he taught extremely well and made the compacted summer course manageable with lax deadlines. Overall i enjoyed the course and I learned a lot from putting my time and effort into it, really made me a master at R.
Amazing Professor! Extremely helpful during Office Hours, too!

Excellent lecturer, knowledgeable, & kind. He was especially helpful during the probability & statistical inference units, which were hard to grasp at first, but he articulated them very clearly. 

He cares a lot about his students to the point of making us a cheat sheet for the final during Thanksgiving break. Definitely pick him as a lecturer.

If you're choosing between lectures, def pick Cameron. Very knowledgeable about the subject and lectures are really clear. I started going to his lectures bc he was so much better at explaining things. Super dedicated to helping out students and goes above and beyond to help you succeed, both with your grade and preparing you for other stat classes

Super smart and is more than willing to help students who are struggling. The second half of the semester was very statistics focused, which was confusing at first, but thanks to Professor Jones' help it was manageable. He puts a great deal of effort into his lecture notes and creating resources for his students. Very sweet and caring.

Cameron was not bad for being the first time he lectures this class (he's usually a TA), but I wish he could grade exams a bit more generously. I don't feel the grade I received reflects my knowledge of this course.

Cameron is so much better than the original lecturer I was enrolled with (Bi Cheng Wu). After going to Cameron's lectures and using his notes instead, the material made so much more sense and everything was so much clearer. He's so much more friendly and open with students and so much better at presenting and explaining information.

This may be weird but he is sweet. Love the emojis he used in emails. He is so humble while also knowledgable. I'm pretty sure he has more than what's being taught in this class, but he makes important stuffs clear to students.

Cameron is so awesome. He is so caring and nice. Notes are clear and detailed. Each lec is recorded. Assignments are given once a week, but they are manageable and you genuinely learned a lot. I knew nothing about R before, but now I can easily grasp the basic R code and do some small projects. This is a great course! Highly recommend with Cameron!

Cameron is great. I am signed up with a different lecturer, but started going to Cameron's the last month or so after he substituted our section. He explains things WAY more clearly, his lectures are very straight forward, he's overall a great & extremely caring guy, and loves answering questions. I don't have anything bad to say, take 240 with him

Exceptional lecturer, this was his first semester as a lecturer but honestly can teach better than a lot of other professors.

He explains the content very well and clearly, gives a lot of time for students to ask questions during lecture, and always responds to questions and concerns asked online. 

Would highly recommend for STAT240
Cameron is the best lecturer of STAT 240!

Cameron was an ok junior TA, and certainly puts a lot of effort in his discussion sections, which is appreciated but he tends to overdo it, and it ends up feeling disingenuous. He can be tough when grading with the pretext that this would help our grades later... but the truth is that I missed the next letter grade thanks to his "kind" act.

Cameron Jones has been a TA for Stat 240 for the longest time and has taught me more about Stats than my actual professor did. He is now TEACHING Stat 240 in 2024, so I thought I would start the hype. Great guy - caring, crazy smart, and funny. Easy to talk to - if I knew he was teaching this class in the spring I would have waited.
